attributes.action: Get rid of the £120 year Nurses Registration Fee that All nurses have to pay.
attributes.additional_details: No other profession is required to pay and annual fee to do a job they are trained for, so why should nurses who put themselves on the front line during lockdown be expected to pay £120 to stay on a registered, particularly when they are underpaid to start with. Getting rid of the fee would be a nice gesture and a way of saying thank you
attributes.background: Get rid of the £120 a year registration fee nurses are required to pay to be able to do their job.

rejection.details:
The level of registrations fees are a matter for independent regulators such as the General Medical Council and Nursing and Midwifery Council, and not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to reimburse health care professionals for professional registration fees, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307399

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to fund health regulators directly, so they do not need to charge a registration fee.
